Nightlight:

=E2=80=9CI=E2=80=99m very lucky to have Rodimus in my life=E2=
=80=9Dsaid Nightlight =E2=80=9CThat and the birth of Elita were the best th=
ings that happened in my life=E2=80=9D

From: Sandy Panico 
Sent: Tuesday, =
July 19, 2011 8:50 AM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: MEdic Bay


=


Nightshift turns his head to Nightlight and reaches out to put a friendly=
 hand on hers, to show his support.

" It's okay, Bump knows what he's do'n=
.  In no time you'll be back on your feet bust'n Predacon and Decepticon af=
t from here back ta Cybertron.  And none of those jokers are gonna think tw=
ice about mess'n with you again. You got someth'n they don't have, and neve=
r will have, a good spark in you spark chamber."

He then lies back in his =
repair chamber.

" Rodimus is real lucky ta have someone like you in his li=
fe.  I never got the chance ta find someone back home.  Always too many thi=
ngs go'n on and no time for relationships.  If I could tell the other Autob=
ots someth'n I'd tell them ta enjoy the little things in life, the simple p=
leasures it has ta offer.  Because if ya don't enjoy them while you're aliv=
e, you'll never get the chance again after you're gone."  

Perpetually on =
the move and constantly busy. 

On Jul 19, 2011, at 2:22 AM, Airshadow Nigh=
tstar <airly2002@...> wrote:


    
  Nightlight:

  "I can stand i=
t"said firmly the femme "you can start when you consider it 
  ready"

  --=
---Original Message----- 
  From: Sandy Panico
  Sent: Monday, July 18, 201=
1 12:36 PM
  To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
  Subject: Re: MEdic Bay

  Nightsh=
ift nods casually to Bump.

  " Just keep me as is, without the dents and d=
amage, a set of all weather, 
  all terrain tires, heavy duty if they're av=
ailable and a launching system 
  for my alt mode so I can deploy grenades =
as well as missile darts. Oh 
  yeah, new suspension system and a refresher=
 paint job and rust prevention 
  treatment."

  He smiles.

  "Just kidd'n=
 about the paint job thing."

  Perpetually on the move and constantly busy=
.

  On Jul 18, 2011, at 8:02 AM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> =
wrote:

  >> <OLD>
  >>
  >> =E2=80=9CHow longer have I to wait to leave th=
is place and get my beast mode?=E2=80=9Dsaid
  >> Nightlight and then she l=
ooked at Nightshift and said =E2=80=9CI remember you,
  >> you were one of =
the maximals that were trapped in the throne room of
  >> Blackfortress=E2=
=80=9D
  >
  > <NEW>
  >
  > There was an understanding nod from BUMP, "We =
will have you out of
  > here just as soon as we can." He walked over to NI=
GHTLIGHT and
  > activated a small viewscreen next to her bed. "Fuzors are =
far more
  > difficult to do, but it is possible."
  >
  > There was a smil=
e from the physist, "Remember, they were originaly
  > created from a mista=
ke in the scanners. But I think we have a way to
  > reproduce it controlla=
bly, as long as you think your spark can handle
  > it."
  >
  >> <OLD>
  >=
>
  >> Nightshift looks to Nightlight with a friendly smile. He was happy t=
o 
  >> see
  >> that Nightlight remembered who he was. He had also been co=
ncerned for 
  >> her
  >> safety as were the others.
  >>
  >> " And I'd g=
o through it again too, if I had ta. It's real nice ta have 
  >> ya
  >> b=
ack. I just wish we knew what Hydras weakness is. The problem is that
  >> =
guy's got too many sets of eyes on 'em and in his alt form... Wait Thats 
 =
 >> it,
  >> why didn't I think of this before? Nightlight, I get it now. I=
 bet that 
  >> if
  >> he lost all visual capabilities, Hydras would be se=
verely compromised. 
  >> On
  >> the other hand, Tucson lost the last figh=
t because Hydras had 'em at a
  >> disadvantage. But if Tucson took out all=
 his visual circuitry, then he
  >> would have the upper hand. Tucson's bee=
n blind a long time, it's second
  >> nature ta him ta fight that way. But =
it's not for Hydras. "
  >>
  >> He turns his head over to Bump.
  >>
  >> =
" How would we go about knock'n out Hydras visual circuitry?"
  >
  >
  > <=
NEW>
  >
  > There was a noncommital shrug from BUMP, "Well a simple flash-=
bang
  > grenade could do it. It is basically a bright light followed by a
=
  > deafening noise." He shrugged again, "I am not typically a weapons
  > =
engineer, but they should be in the weapons stores."
  >
  > BUMP glanced a=
t the readouts displaying NIGHTLIGHT's vital signs,
  > nodding when everyt=
hing looked good. He looked back at NIGHTSHIFT,
  > "Did you have anything =
specific in mind?"
